body_html:
@girving - not sure why, but last night I thought it would be three. Sorry for that! It may make more sense to just use a tf.case() op for the sake extensibility (easier to add GIF/bitmap support).

One final question: what is the best way to throw an error for the default case (bytes not recognized as any available image type)? The easiest thing I can think of right now is simply raising an error in a py_func op, but I don't know whether or not py_func is apropos for Op wrappers.

One final question: what is the best way to throw an error for the default case (bytes not recognized as any available image type)? The easiest thing I can think of right now is simply raising an error in a py_func op, but I don't know whether or not py_func is apropos for Op wrappers.
body:
@girving - not sure why, but last night I thought it would be three. Sorry for that! It may make more sense to just use a `tf.case()` op for the sake extensibility (easier to add GIF/bitmap support). 

One final question: what is the best way to throw an error for the default case (bytes not recognized as any available image type)? The easiest thing I can think of right now is simply raising an error in a `py_func` op, but I don't know whether or not `py_func` is apropos for Op wrappers.
